result.execSummary:
The defendant James M. Berg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DNA sample

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: Report no later than 11-20-25 at 6:00 pm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James M. Berg

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant James M. Berg in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 1:50 pm.  Plea agreement.  Def to enter plea to charge. Sentence withheld, probation.  Restitution $956.85, jail 10 days and cost. Credit of 1 day  Victim rights have been complied with.  Parties agree with plea agreement.  Court reviews plea questionnaire.  Criminal damage to property - Guilty plea entered.  Constitutional rights and right to jury trial reviewed.  Elements of charge reviewed with penalties.  Court finds def understands charge, penalties and rights.  Factual basis.  Plea accepted, found guilty.  Off record briefly to review information.  Back on record.  Restitution amount changed, $1386.85.  Def will stipulate to this amount.  Sentencing argument by state.  Atty Abernethy-Mays presents arguments.  Brief statement by def.  Court accepts plea agreement.  Sentence withheld, 1 yr probation.  Credit for 1 day if revoked,  Cost ordered, includes DNA surcharge.  DNA sample.   Jail 5 days, huber privileges.  Bond to be returned to poster.  Restitution  $1356.85   Report to jail no later than 11-20-15 at 6:00 pm    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Post conviction rights.

Defendant James M. Berg in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter was set for plea and sentencing.  Matter adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for James M. Berg
Current: 929 5th Avenue #203, Antigo, WI 54409 United States  (Effective: 08-03-2015)
Prior: 827.5 5th Ave, Antigo, WI 54409
No contact with A. S. or Samolinski Shoe

Defendant James M. Berg in court.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Def does not have copy of complaint.  State provides copy to def.  Court reads charge with possible penalties.  Def advised of right to an atty.  Def request to represent himself.  Court directs clerk to enter not guilty plea.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
